title: If a segments container is created for Swift, it uses the default (or rclone configured) storage policy
body:

#### The associated forum post URL from `https://forum.rclone.org`

N/A

#### What is your current rclone version (output from `rclone version`)?

1.71.1

#### What problem are you are trying to solve?

I'd expect that if rclone needs to create a segments container it would use the same storage policy of the base container. It doesn't, it uses either the policy configured for the remote in rclone.conf (etc) or the default policy configured for Swift.

X-Storage-Policy for the base container is fetched, and is available to rclone.

How this exhibits is our customers may naively create a multi region replicated container for the segments when they intended it to be single region - as used for the base container.

I just ran into this while testing some other behaviour.

#### How do you think rclone should be changed to solve that?

If storage_policy isn't set locally, then X-Storage-Policy from the base container should be used when creating the segments container.
